I DO THIS for ALL of the 'little Crystal’s' that were bright kids, with bright futures and bright ideas, but were underserved by burnt out teachers that dimmed their student’s lights with skepticism, punitive actions and low expectations...

We are excited to share the School Nutrition Program will be providing meals to students during online learning.

Please stay tuned to our social media outlets for more information regarding the School Nutrition Program in the upcoming school year.

post_text: Our Seniors are not the only ones receiving scholarships -- Justin Mack one of our 7th graders was chosen to receive one of only 15 statewide Victor E. Bell scholarships awarded by the College Foundation of North Carolina (CFNC). The Victor E. Bell Jr. Scholarship Program was established to encourage and assist high-potential students to pursue higher education. The scholarship program encourages students with academic ability and promise to maintain their scholastic standing and achieve a college degree. Each individual scholarship award is $2,000 per recipient per year up to a maximum total contribution of $20,000. The foundation awards seventh grade student’s scholarships based on their end of year sixth grade academic performance. Justin is the first student from SCCS to receive this honor. For those of you who know Justin, are aware of how diligently this young scholar works not only academically, but in his extracurricular endeavors as well.

As we close out Teacher Appreciation week, we want to share some words one of teachers shared with her colleagues yesterday:

“I think in this time it is important to just acknowledge the really awesome Black male teachers that work in our building. I see you interacting with the kids and showing them what true Black Boy joy is. I see you showing them pride in oneself and culture. I see you showing them that despite their circumstances and what the world thinks of them, they can make it. We don’t say it enough in our building, but to the Black male teachers we have, you are truly awesome. You are so very important to what we do and I admire the way you carry yourselves in the building with the weight of the world and the weight that our children bring to us.”

We are proud to have 30 amazing male teachers who invest in our Wildcats.

Governor Roy Cooper has ordered all K-12 schools to close for two weeks effective Monday, March 16, 2020. This is in response to the continuing issues with the corona virus. Sugar Creek will reschedule our spring break for this time. Spring break will now run from Monday, March 16th through Monday, March 30th. Students will return to school on Tuesday, March 31st.

We realize this is a rapidly changing environment and we will keep you informed of any new information. Please go to our website: https://thesugarcreek.org/contact-form/ to complete a contact form to assure that we have the most updated contact information for you.

We have a webpage on our website with information on the corona virus and its effect on the school calendar. We will keep it updated.
We realize this is a stressful and difficult situation for everyone. Above all, we want to ensure your health and safety. We will continue to follow the guidance of the state Department of Public School and the State Health Department.
